description: Define a sub-step data model for onboarding progress (server + client types).
Implement parent step status derivation rules from sub-steps (complete only when all complete).
Update onboarding step metadata for Secure Identity & SSO to use CTA href `/msp/profile?tab=Single+Sign-On`.
Replace the dashboard-visible step title/description for `client_portal_domain` to 'Set Up Customer Portal' and update CTA label copy accordingly.
Add Customer Portal sub-steps: (1) Portal custom domain, (2) Portal color/logo customizations, (3) Invite first contact to the portal.
Implement server resolver for 'Portal custom domain' sub-step using existing portal domain signal.
Implement server resolver for 'Portal color/logo customizations' sub-step (complete when any customer portal configuration exists).
Implement server resolver for 'Invite first contact' sub-step (complete when a portal invite exists).
Replace the dashboard-visible step title/description for `managed_email` to 'Configure Email' and update CTA label copy accordingly.
Add Email sub-steps: (1) Configure inbound email, (2) Configure outbound custom email domain.
Implement server resolver for 'Configure inbound email' sub-step (complete when any inbound email provider row exists).
Implement server resolver for 'Configure outbound custom email domain' sub-step using existing managed email domain verification signal.
Expose derived sub-step progress metadata to the client so existing progress UI (progress bar / ring) can reflect 0..100% completion for multi-substep steps.
Update `useOnboardingProgress` to enrich step definitions with sub-step display metadata and maintain analytics firing on parent step completion transitions.
Update onboarding checklist drawer UI to render sub-step checkmarks inside the step card.
Update dashboard quick-start cards to render sub-step checkmarks (or a compact 'X/Y complete' summary) for steps that have sub-steps.
Ensure UI remains backward-compatible when `substeps` is missing or empty in the progress payload.
Add basic unit tests for parent status derivation from sub-steps (not_started / in_progress / blocked / complete).
Add integration-level coverage verifying `getOnboardingProgressAction` returns the expected sub-step structure for portal/email steps.
